Execution

Class Execution

  • java.lang.Object
    • Execution.Execution

  • public class Execution
extends java.lang.Object
    The execution object for the EVM. This class implements the execution loop for the EVM. There is onlyl one instance of this class, except for classes that contain static initializers. When a class with a static initializer is loaded, a new Execution object is created to execute the initialization code.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Execution

        public Execution(java.lang.String className,
         java.lang.String methodName,
         OperandStack os)
        Sets up a new execution, loads the class and method that is to be executed and sets up a new activation record for it. We need to take in the name of the method as it can be either "main" or "".
        Parameters:
        className - The name of the class that contains the method that this execution will start with.
        methodName - The name of the method that this execution will start with.

    • Method Detail

      • dup

        public void dup(int opCode,
       OperandStack operandStack)
        Duplicates words on the operandstack. In real JVM a Double or a Long take up 2 stack words, but EVM Doubles and Longs do not, so since dup2 can be used to either duplicate 2 single word values or 1 double word value, we need to check the type of what is on the stack before we decide if we should duplicate just one value or two. Possible instructions: dup, dup2, dup_x1, dup_x2, dup2_x1, dup2_x2.
        Parameters:
        opCode - The opcode of the instruction.
        operandStack - The operand stack passed from the current Execution.

      • two

        public void two(int opCode,
       int from,
       int to,
       OperandStack operandStack)
        Converts the type and value of the top element on the operand stack. Possible instructions: i2b, i2s, i2c,i2d, i2f, i2l, d2f, d2l, d2i, f2i, f2d, f2l, l2i, l2f, l2d
        Parameters:
        from - The type we are converting from - this should match the type of the object at the top of the stack.
        to - The type we are converting to.
        operandStack - The operand stack.

      • negate

        public void negate(int opCode,
          int type,
          OperandStack operandStack)
        Negates the value on top of the operand stack. Possible instructions: ineg, fneg, dneg, lneg
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the element we want to negate. This should match the type of the element on the top of the operand stack.
        operandStack - The operand stack.

      • cmp

        public void cmp(int opCode,
       int type,
       OperandStack operandStack)
        Compares two values on top of the operand stack and pushes either -1, 0, or 1 on to the operand stack. Possible instructions: fcmpl, fcmpg, dcmpl, dcmpg, lcmp
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the two elements on top of the stack to be compared.
        operandStack - The operand stack.

      • swap

        public void swap(int opCode,
        OperandStack operandStack)
        Swaps the top two elements on the operand stack. Note, this only works if neither are double of long. Possible instructions: swap
        Parameters:
        operandStack - The operand stack.

      • logic

        public void logic(int opCode,
         int type,
         OperandStack operandStack)
        Performs all the logic operands that can be applied to elements on the operand stack. Possible instructions: iand, ior, ixor, lan, lor, lxor
        Parameters:
        opCode - The operation code of the instruction.
        type - The type of the operation
        operandStack - The operand Stack
